function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Estimates imply that the populations in Europe are not close to herd immunity","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Regional variations in epidemic trends within countries","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Implicit lag in time affecting intervention impact on deaths","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bias in model due to inclusion of deaths from non-locally acquired infections","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of independent random times for the incubation period and time between onset of symptoms and death","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uncertainty in infection model","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate handling of serial interval distribution","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate preparation for initial seeding of infections","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of hamiltonian monte carlo hmc sampler","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lag between deaths and infections in data interpretation","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in daily deaths due to covid-19","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity of estimates to serial interval distribution","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of nonparametric function with a gaussian process prior distribution","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Complex mathematical model","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on parameter values","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on historical data","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased risk of infectious diseases in built environments with low walkability and active travel infrastructure","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to detect statistically significant relationships between built environment measures and covid-19 infection and mortality rates due to fluid and rapidly evolving nature of covid-19 data.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of physical environment on behavior and exposures leading to increased risk of disease transmission and chronic conditions.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure effects of the environment may directly impact infection","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unreliable estimates of infection rates due to testing variations and early data collection","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulties in detecting relationships between physical environments, exposures, behaviors, and health outcomes","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the impact of built environment on covid-19 transmission","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for misinterpretation of study findings leading to inappropriate urban planning decisions","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in measuring early infection rates","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Built environment correlated with covid-19 mortality","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of county-level data for analyzing covid-19 spread and mortality may oversimplify the geographic heterogeneity of the disease.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on data from a single source for built and natural environment measures may introduce bias or inaccuracies in the analysis.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High residential density may lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within the neighborhood","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disconnected street networks can limit access to healthcare facilities and increase reliance on vehicles for travel","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher auto-oriented regional accessibility can lead to decreased participation in sustainable and healthy travel","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using traditional fixed parameter regression models without considering dynamic factors may lead to inaccurate insights into the relationship between covid-19 fatality rate, obesity, and the built environment.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of statistically significant relationship between natural environment and prevalence of obesity","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider smaller areas immediately around where people live and are exposed may limit the accuracy of the findings.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Study documents how chronic disease and covid-19 are related to the built and natural environment, potentially indicating environmental factors that contribute to disease spread.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Linking built environment and natural environment with chronic and infectious disease covid-19 pandemics","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obesity mediating the relationship between the built and natural environment and covid-19 mortality","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compact development and densification bringing people together","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High reliance on private vehicles and low support for public transit","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compact transit-oriented development","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Densification of communities leading to higher population density","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obesity and old age correlated with greater covid-19 mortality risk","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of active travel supportive infrastructure","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of construction material supply","category":"Land Use","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obstruction of construction due to movement restrictions","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on supply chain and construction industry","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of exclusive study on the impact of covid-19 on the construction industry","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conducting exploratory interviews with construction experts without proper protective measures may lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using questionnaire surveys without proper safeguards can result in the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"}]}
